page.title: 14FRIDAYWOODS
page.content: {PARK FARM _}was originally parkland belonging to Berechurch Hall. The area contains a network of ancient trackways. A Romam Villa has been partially excavated to reveal pottery and jewellery of the second and third centuries. It is thought that there were many smallholdings of Roman army veterans who settled in the Colonia. The present owner of Park Farm keeps Highland Cattle and the farm now covers 40 acres. {FRIDAYWOOD FARM _}covers 440 acres The farmer is Mr. Lochore. He employs one man for most tasks are now done by machinery. Over 200 acres are used for arable crops,cereals,sugarbeet. Over 300 sheep and 40 cattle are out to pasture. {COLCHESTR MODEL SOLDIER SOCIETY_}the old barn next to the Maypole pub has been converted into a military museum.
